name: Freedom of Information Act
description: Key provisions of the Freedom of Information Act 2011 relating to access, exemptions, obligations, and penalties.

questions.question: In which year was the Freedom of Information Act enacted in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The Freedom of Information Act was signed into law in 2011 by President Goodluck Jonathan.

questions.question: What is the main objective of the Freedom of Information Act?
options: To ensure public access to information held by public institutions
To limit freedom of the press
questions.explanation: The FOI Act aims to make public records accessible to citizens, enhancing transparency and accountability.

questions.question: Under the FOI Act, within how many days must a public institution respond to a request for information?
questions.explanation: Section 4 of the FOI Act stipulates that public institutions must respond to requests within 7 days.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act guarantees the right of any person to access public records?
questions.explanation: Section 1 of the FOI Act guarantees the right of any person to access or request information from public institutions.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT exempted from disclosure under the FOI Act?
questions.explanation: Budget allocations are public information and cannot be withheld under the FOI Act.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act mandates every public institution to keep records?
questions.explanation: Section 2 of the FOI Act mandates public institutions to maintain proper records for easy access.

questions.question: What penalty is imposed on any officer who wrongfully denies access to information?
questions.explanation: The FOI Act imposes a fine of â‚¦500,000 on officers who unlawfully deny access to information.

questions.question: Which body is responsible for ensuring compliance with the FOI Act?
questions.explanation: The Attorney-General of the Federation is responsible for oversight and reporting on compliance with the FOI Act.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act obliges institutions to proactively publish certain categories of information?
questions.explanation: Section 2 requires public institutions to proactively publish categories of information without waiting for requests.

questions.question: What recourse does an applicant have if denied access to information?
questions.explanation: Section 20 provides that applicants may challenge denials of access in a court of law.

questions.question: Who bears the burden of proof when a request for information is denied?
questions.explanation: Section 24 places the burden of proof on the institution that denies access to information.

questions.question: Under the FOI Act, are foreign nationals allowed to request information?
options: Yes, but only through a Nigerian lawyer
questions.explanation: Section 1 makes the right of access available to 'any person,' not limited to Nigerian citizens.

questions.question: What is the maximum extension period for an FOI request if additional time is needed?
questions.explanation: The Act allows a maximum extension of 7 additional days to respond where necessary.

questions.question: Which of the following is exempt under the FOI Act?
questions.explanation: Trade secrets and commercial confidentiality are exempt from disclosure under Section 15.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act protects whistleblowers from penalties?
questions.explanation: Section 27 protects officers from prosecution for releasing information in good faith.

questions.question: What is the status of the FOI Act in relation to state governments?
options: It automatically applies to all states
States must domesticate it through their Houses of Assembly
It applies only to Lagos and Abuja
questions.explanation: The FOI Act applies federally, but states must domesticate it to apply within their jurisdiction.

questions.question: Who has the authority to issue guidelines for FOI implementation?
questions.explanation: The Attorney-General of the Federation issues implementation guidelines and annual compliance reports.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act criminalizes destruction of public records?
questions.explanation: Section 29 criminalizes destruction or falsification of public records and prescribes penalties.

questions.question: What is the fine for wrongful destruction of records under FOI Act?
questions.explanation: Section 29 prescribes a â‚¦500,000 fine for wrongful destruction or falsification of public records.

questions.question: Under the FOI Act, what is the duty of public institutions regarding training?
options: They must train staff on records management and access procedures
They must rely only on external consultants
They are exempt from staff training
questions.explanation: The Act requires institutions to train staff to ensure effective implementation and compliance.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act provides that information should be in the language understandable to the applicant?
questions.explanation: Section 3(4) requires that information be provided in a language understandable to the applicant when reasonably practicable.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act mandates public institutions to submit annual compliance reports on FOI requests to the Attorney-General?
questions.explanation: Section 2(7) mandates public institutions to submit annual compliance reports on FOI requests to the Attorney-General of the Federation.

questions.question: Which section exempts cabinet papers and deliberations of government from disclosure?
questions.explanation: Section 11 exempts cabinet papers, records of deliberations, and decisions of the Executive Council of the Federation.

questions.question: Which section exempts personal information that would constitute an invasion of privacy?
questions.explanation: Section 14 exempts personal information from disclosure to protect individual privacy rights.

questions.question: Which section exempts trade secrets and commercial confidentiality from disclosure?
questions.explanation: Section 15 exempts trade secrets, commercial or financial information obtained in confidence.

questions.question: Which section protects international relations and defence from disclosure?
questions.explanation: Section 12 exempts information that could affect national security, defence, or international relations.

questions.question: Which section exempts professional privileges such as lawyer-client communication?
questions.explanation: Section 16 exempts professional privileges like solicitor-client communication from disclosure.

questions.question: Which section exempts research materials and pending academic work?
questions.explanation: Section 19 exempts research materials and examinations from disclosure until completion.

questions.question: Which section provides that exempt information may still be disclosed if public interest outweighs harm?
questions.explanation: Section 28 introduces the public interest test, allowing disclosure if public benefit outweighs harm.

questions.question: Which section makes it an offence to alter or falsify public records?
questions.explanation: Section 29 makes alteration or falsification of records a criminal offence with penalties.

questions.question: Which section requires institutions to designate FOI desk officers?
questions.explanation: Section 5(1) requires every institution to designate officers responsible for handling FOI requests.

questions.question: Which section exempts test questions and examination materials from disclosure?
questions.explanation: Section 19 exempts examination materials and test questions from disclosure until after administration.

questions.question: Which section obliges institutions to maintain records in machine-readable formats?
questions.explanation: Section 6(2) requires public institutions to keep records in formats that make them easily accessible.

questions.question: Which section provides for transfer of FOI requests if another institution holds the information?
questions.explanation: Section 7 provides for transfer of requests where the information is held by another institution.

questions.question: Which section allows partial disclosure where only part of a record is exempt?
questions.explanation: Section 13 allows partial disclosure of non-exempt portions of a record.

questions.question: Which section provides protection from liability for officers who disclose information in good faith?
questions.explanation: Section 27 provides immunity for officers who release information in good faith.

questions.question: Which section prohibits destruction of records needed for pending FOI requests?
questions.explanation: Section 29 prohibits destruction of records subject to FOI requests and prescribes penalties.

questions.question: Which section mandates wide dissemination of information to the public?
questions.explanation: Section 2(3) mandates public institutions to widely disseminate information through various media.

questions.question: Which section exempts law enforcement records that could interfere with investigations?
questions.explanation: Section 12 exempts law enforcement records that may interfere with investigations or prosecutions.

questions.question: Which section exempts geological and mineral exploration data?
questions.explanation: Section 17 exempts geological and mineral exploration records from disclosure.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act covers information affecting personal safety?
questions.explanation: Section 16 exempts disclosure of information that could endanger the life or physical safety of any individual.

questions.question: Which section provides for fees to cover the cost of duplication and transcription?
questions.explanation: Section 8(1) allows institutions to charge fees covering costs of duplication or transcription of records.

questions.question: Which section provides that applicants do not need to show reasons for requesting information?
questions.explanation: Section 1(2) makes clear that no applicant needs to demonstrate interest or reasons for requesting information.

questions.question: Which section requires that public institutions keep training programs for their officials?
questions.explanation: Section 5 requires public institutions to train officials to ensure effective implementation of the Act.

questions.question: Which section obliges the Attorney-General to prepare and submit an annual report on FOI implementation?
questions.explanation: Section 32 requires the Attorney-General of the Federation to submit an annual report to the National Assembly.

questions.question: Which section provides that public institutions must maintain updated indexes of records?
questions.explanation: Section 6(1) mandates public institutions to maintain updated indexes of their records for accessibility.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act emphasizes the proactive disclosure of financial records?
questions.explanation: Section 2(3) emphasizes proactive disclosure of information, including financial records, without waiting for requests.

questions.question: Which section exempts information that could prejudice pending criminal proceedings?
questions.explanation: Section 12 exempts records that could interfere with investigations or prejudice pending criminal cases.

questions.question: Which section provides that exemptions should be narrowly interpreted?
questions.explanation: Section 28(1) states that exemptions must be interpreted narrowly in favor of disclosure.

questions.question: Which section criminalizes willful concealment of public records?
questions.explanation: Section 29 criminalizes willful concealment, destruction, or falsification of public records.

questions.question: Which section of the FOI Act provides that all institutions must make information available in accessible formats?
questions.explanation: Section 6(2) provides that records must be kept in accessible formats such as machine-readable versions.

questions.question: Which section protects officers from civil or criminal liability when they disclose information under the Act?
questions.explanation: Section 27 protects officers from liability when they disclose information in good faith.

questions.question: Which section requires the Attorney-General to compile and publish annual compliance reports?
questions.explanation: Section 32 requires the Attorney-General to compile and publish annual FOI compliance reports.

questions.question: Which section requires every institution to keep proper indexes of their records?
questions.explanation: Section 6(1) mandates public institutions to keep proper indexes of their records for easy accessibility.

questions.question: Which section emphasizes proactive publication of information categories such as budgets and contracts?
questions.explanation: Section 2(3) emphasizes proactive disclosure of categories like budgets, contracts, and financial data.
